thread.title: Europe Car Lobby Warns on Emissions Targets

author: Emre Peker
title: Europe Car Lobby Warns on Emissions Targets
text:
BRUSSELS—The European Union’s push to cut carbon-dioxide emissions from cars threatens to derail auto makers’ fragile recovery, the industry’s lobby said Wednesday, forecasting slower sales growth and signalling a clash over regulations.
Car sales rose by 3.4% last year in the EU to more than 15 million units, the highest since 2007, a year before the global financial crisis, according to the European Automobile Manufacturers’ Association. The Brussels-based group, known as ACEA, said the rate of new registrations will slow... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
